text.value: Has the part 1 and 2 of Adult CRF form been filled in?
Has this Part 3 of CRF form been filed together with Part 1 and 2 from the recruited participant?
Day of pre-enrolment screening study: D-2
Day of pre-enrolment screening study: D-3
Was participant briefed on the study schedule?
Was the participant given an up-to-date study calendar?
Was a field worker from Ngerenya and known to the participant given an up-to-date study calendar?
If 'no' to any of the above, please explain why
Was screening at Ngerenya done within the past 30 days?
If YES: please test for pregnancy only.
If NO: please proceed with full pre-enrolment screening.

*Please confirm that the participant meets all the inclusion criteria below:* - Healthy adult aged 18-45 years - Able and willing (in the Investigator's opinion) to comply with all study requirements - Body weight over 50Kg - Non-pregnant, non-lactating - Use of effective method of contraception for duration of study for female participants (as detailed in Protocol) - Able and willing to provide informed consent - Plans to remain available for study participation within the next 7 months
Does the paricipant meet all the inclusion criteria?

*Please confirm that the participant does **not** meet any of the **exclusion** criteria* - Any confirmed or suspected use of medication in the past 30 days that may affect the outcomes of the study (as detailed in Protocol) - Body weight below 50Kg - Pregnant or lactating - Clinically significant laboratory abnormality as judged by the study clinician - Hypersensitivity against any of the study drugs or other allergic / hypersensitivity conditions that may, in the eyes of the investigator, interfere with the study - Any significant disease, disorder or situation which, in the opinion of the Investigator may either put the participants at risk because of participation in the trial, or may influence the result of the trial, or the participant's ability to participate in the trial
Does the paricipant meet any of the exclusion criteria?
(Select 'no' if participant does not meet any of the above criteria)
The pulse rate falls in the normal range (51-100).
The pulse rate does not fall into the normal range (51-100). Select if it is NCS or CS.
Since the pulse rate is abnormal, specify the DAIDS Grade
The systolic blood pressure falls in the normal range (90-140 mmHg)
The systolic blood pressure does not fall in the normal range (90-140 mmHg). Select if it is NCS or CS.
Since the systolic blood pressure is abnormal, specify the DAIDS Grade
The diastolic blood pressure falls in the normal range (60-90 mmHg)
The diastolic blood pressure does not fall in the normal range (60-90 mmHg). Select if it is NCS or CS.
Since the systolic blood pressure is abnormal, specify the DAIDS Grade
Has the participant acquired new conditions since screening visit?
List all new conditions since screening visit. Where possible give a diagnosis not the symptom.
Has the participant taken any medications in the last 30 days?
For each medication, provide the name, dosage, frequency, route, and indication.
Please given the participant a sterile container and ask them to collect mid-flow urine.
Did the participant collect the urine?
If no, what is the reason?
Initials of person who collected the sample
Was the Urine ß-hCG test positive or negative?
#### Screening results: malaria rapid diagnostic test (mRDT)
Please collect 0.05ml blood through finger-prick for malaria rapid diagnostic test (mRDT)
If no, what is the reason?
Initials of person who collected the mRDT sample
Was the mRDT test positive or negative?
#### Screening results: biochemistry and full blood picture
Please collect 9mls of venous blood for laboratory tests
If no, what is the reason?
Initials of person who collected the sample
Was the following sample collected? Sample: 4ml EDTA Tube: 4ml purple top Test to be requested: full blood count
Was the following sample collected? Sample: 5ml SST Tube: 5ml yellow top Test to be requested: biochemistry
Indicate the results for the following tests done
Description of abnormal clinically significant results
Do any results contradict study entry?
If yes, participant must be excluded, please complete end of study page

I have checked the participant's inclusion and exclusion criteria, signed consent form CRF screening examination, pre-enrolment screening and blood results and in discussion with the Principal Investigator(s) I find the participant is:
If participant was ineligible were screening results given to the participant?
If the participant was not given his/her screening results, why not?
Initials of individual who contacted the participant
If participant is eligible please enrol the participant in the study and inform them of the next study visit
Which of the following study groups is the eligible participant randomized to?
If the participant is randomized to group C or D, their next visit is on D0 of their schedule (48 hours later).
If the participant is randomized to group B, their next visit is on D-2 of their schedule (24h later).
If the participant is randomized to groups A1 or A2, their next visit is on D-1 of their schedule (24h later).
If participant is randomised to group A1 or A2, have they been informed that the next visit requires an overnight stay?
Does the participant have a study calendar with next planned visit to KWTRP?
Has the participant understood when and the nature of their next study visit?
Has the field worker been given the participant's calendar and asked to remind him/her of their study visits?
